title: FCC Plans December Vote Kill Net Neutrality Rules
text: The U S  Federal Communications Commission next month planning vote kill Obama era rules demanding fair treatment web traffic may decide vacate regulations altogether  according people familiar plans  The move would reignite years long debate seen Republicans broadband providers seeking eliminate rules  Democrats technology companies support them  The regulations passed 2015 bar broadband providers AT T Inc  Comcast Corp  interfering web traffic sent Google  Facebook Inc  others  FCC Chairman Ajit Pai  chosen President Donald Trump  April proposed gutting rules asked public reaction aren t needed discourage investment  part subject companies complex unpredictable regulations  Democrats technology companies say rules needed make sure telecommunications providers don t favor business partners harm rivals  Why Republicans Want Nix U S  Net Neutrality Rules  QuickTake The agency declined comment timing vote   We don t anything report point  said Tina Pelkey  spokeswoman commission  Pai April proposed FCC end designation broadband companies common carriers  That would remove legal authority underpins net neutrality rules  Pai could also choose find authority FCC s powers promote broadband  That would leave rules without apparent legal footing  leading turn conclusion agency lacks authority even issue revised  less stringent regulations  The April proposal also asked agency consider lifting bans blocking web traffic building  fast lanes  favor willing pay faster service  Immediate Reaction News December vote drew immediate reactions   Abandoning bipartisan net neutrality principles threatens kill streaming revolution hurt businesses  large small  migrating cloud record speeds  said Chip Pickering  chief executive officer Incompas trade group members Scorecard The current regulations forbid broadband providers blocking slowing web traffic  charging higher fees return quicker passage networks  Supporters rules say needed keep network owners unfairly squelching rivals discouraging web startups  Critics say rules discourage investment exposing companies threat heavier regulation including pricing mandates  marketplace competition discipline broadband providers  The regulation survived court challenge broadband providers last year  Trump s White House opposed rules  In July  Pai s critics protested  White House spokesman said administration  supports FCC s efforts roll back burdensome  monopoly era regulations    With assistance Jennifer Epstein

blackouts could fatal  The test results came back normal  prompting tests  also normal  In autumn  I passed getting bed  point possibility impending death really started bother me  I lay awake night listening pulse suspiciously  surveilling enemy within  Finally  another doctor wanted know I drinking enough water  Dehydration could cause naturally low blood pressure fall even lower  Low enough faint abruptly  She shrugged  Maybe  It true I drank little water  days none all  And benign explanation blackouts lot appeal me  nonfatal  something I could fix  I seized worth  arguably more  Why wasn t I drinking enough water  I wasn t thirsty  wasn t sure thirst felt like  The symptoms dehydration dry mouth  headaches were  hand  familiar  The cultural critic Mark Greif writes privations  go degree discernment class distinction  To driven basic impulses implies existence rooted primal sensation  discerning person accumulated much culture room left natural instinct  Was dehydration symptom class aspiration  Was response cultural messages around femininity  subliminal wishing away physical desire  Was something wrong brain  It point I discovered app called WaterMinder  Its function simple  Every ninety minutes  issued notification bearing friendly text like  Take break cup water  If I followed advice  I could enter amount consumed app s interface  in millilitres fluid ounces  preferred  A graphic illustrated water entering human body I could even change hair style make look like me  By nightfall  body ideally filled brim bright blue liquid  Many apps muscle territory belonged conventional business  cabs  example  hotels  WaterMinder  contrast  performs function traditionally fulfilled human brain specifically  hypothalamus  regulates thirst  Is hypothalamus ripe disruption  It would seem so  WaterMinder thousands users consistently report trouble remembering something without literally die   With hectic schedule I forget sometimes  one reviewer writes  For months  I used app diligently  entering updates every time I made cup tea drank mouthfuls juice  I compared day to day progress line graph earned badges I reached daily goals  I didn t blackouts  I stopped recording intake continued using reminder notifications  More year passed since last time I fainted  and  frankly  threat total bodily collapse isn t motivator was  When I hear app s chirpy tone emanating bottom handbag  I longer struck terror  I don t take break cup water  I contracted one essential functions body piece software  find that like body technology surprisingly easy ignore

title: To solve Catalonia  Spain needs new constitution

title: Playback
How Congress made tax reform impossible
text: In 1977  economy struggling unemployment 7 percent  Congress launched new job creation program  It done tax code  offering employers  2 100 credit new hire  Over past 40 years  program cost tens billions dollars reformed dozens times  Today  it s small targeted  Employers receive subsidy hiring specific individuals  including food stamp recipients  disabled veterans and  2015  long term unemployed  Helping disadvantaged Americans find work kind thing Democrats Republicans agree on  even today s politically charged atmosphere  But part once in a generation tax overhaul  House Republicans want eliminate decades old program  If plan passes  employers stop receiving tax credit hiring disabled vets long term unemployed people a change experts believe would make harder people toughest situations find work   It would significant barrier us trying encourage people hire people autism  said Tammy Morris  chief program officer Autism Alliance Michigan  opposes provision  The Work Opportunity Tax Credit one dozens small programs chopping block GOP tax plan and whose upset beneficiaries making tax reform political minefield  The plan would also cut tax breaks teachers buy supplies classrooms  investments impoverished areas workers move new job  As analysts read 429 pages bill  released last week  become clearer  tax reform  entails en masse rollback small scale benefits programs go unnoticed vast majority Americans  crucially important beneficiaries  The large number impacted groups already causing significant friction reform  it s likely beginning  Disability rights groups  like Autism Alliance Michigan  veterans  groups  including Veterans Foreign Wars American Legion  speaking removal WOTC   definitely incentivizes employers hire veterans  said Ariel DeJesus  assistant director American Legion  Housing groups state local governments fighting keep tax break supports development low income housing  Pro life groups already convinced House Republicans restore  3 8 billion tax break adoptive parents  repealed original bill  And calls likely grow louder numerous Senate GOP released tax plan  expected repeal limit many similar tax breaks  If sheer number interest groups might seem make ambitious tax reform impossible  there s simple reason  blame lies Congress  As 1977 law suggests  Congress decades using tax code stash subsidies could never get front door budget process  Thanks Democrats Republicans worried tagged spendthrifts  U S  tax code grown vast shadow budget  massive law stacked social programs  incentives economic growth  even special subsidies sports stadiums rum manufacturers  Since early 1990s  shadow spending   known budget wonks  tax expenditures  grown around  600 billion  1 2 trillion  adjusting inflation  Much growth come large  well known tax breaks  like exclusion employer sponsored health insurance mortgage interest deduction  would limited GOP bill  But sheer number tax expenditures also grown half period well  Since social programs buried tax code don t look like spending  politically popular make tax reform devilishly difficult  said Michael Strain  director economic studies American Enterprise Institute   It shows decrease tax bill rather increase amount government spending receive  said   But government spending  He added huge number tax expenditures   It s big comprehensive  How get arms around it  The result GOP s tax plan running afoul dozens groups including numerous small sympathetic constituencies benefit nearly  1 trillion worth breaks existing tax code  Morris described small cleaning company organization works relies Work Opportunity Tax Credit offset costs recruiting training people disabilities   They would stop practice  means individuals go back state funded support  said  It s popular sides aisle portray tax code filled special interest giveaways  GOP plan eliminate tax breaks accrue almost entirely rich  like subsidy sports stadiums  But many tax breaks targeted House Republican bill clear social purposes  encouraging certain behaviors widely seen beneficial American society  That includes deduction employer provided dependent care  helps workers afford care children spouses disabilities  well tax exclusion interest private activity bonds  state local governments use fund low income housing helped attract billions dollars private financing  The plan also eliminates two deductions work related moving expenses  economists believe labor market churn crucial strong labor market  Other tax breaks targeted repeal include deduction employer provided transportation benefits  credit rehabilitation historic buildings credit small businesses improve accessibility disabled individuals  Christopher Howard  political scientist College meet middle  Democrats would like expand government directly Republicans don t want expand it  And agree expand indirectly  The House GOP plan guided philosophy eliminating tax breaks cutting tax rates unleash economic growth  creating better economic outcomes everyone  They want reduce size tax code wiping away special interest giveaways limit even broadly popular tax breaks  like mortgage interest deduction  partially pay tax overhaul  But within broad framework  plenty inconsistencies  For instance  GOP plan eliminates New Markets Tax Credit  encourages businesses invest economically downtrodden areas  doesn t affect similar tax credit investing so called  empowerment zones  poor urban rural areas   Empowerment zones championed House Speaker Paul Ryan s mentor  former Rep  Jack title: First Trials Begin For Those Charged Over Inauguration Day Rioting
text: First Trials Begin For Those Charged Over Inauguration Day Rioting Enlarge image toggle caption Jewel Samad AFP Getty Images Jewel Samad AFP Getty Images Updated 3 37 p m  ET It s nearly 11 spokesman William Miller  Twenty cases dropped  defendants another 20 cases pleaded guilty   one misdemeanors  Today  jury selection starts first batch cases go trial  Miller says six defendants first title: Is It Legal For An Older Man To Court A Child Bride In The U S
text: Is It Legal For An Older Man To Court A Child Bride In The U S  Enlarge image Maria Fabrizio NPR Maria Fabrizio NPR Editor s Note  This story originally published August updated  The national news week dominated accusations U S  Senate candidate Roy Moore   allegations sexually assaulted least two teenage girls also attempted date teenagers 30s  Moore denies allegations  But stories prompted discussion certain  courting  practice pockets fundamentalist Christian community Moore belongs  Older men ask young women  including teenagers  parent s permission eye toward marriage  All raises question  Isn t child marriage   one partners 18   illegal U S  Child marriage isn t practice victimizes girls poor countries  As blog previously reported  it s also long issue United States  involving girls wide range backgrounds  Based state marriage license data sources  advocacy groups experts estimate 2000 2015 alone  well 200 000 children   nearly girls   married  In nearly cases husband adult  A report released summer Tahirih Justice Center sheds new light state laws contributing problem  The center  nonprofit advocacy group works end violence women girls  comprehensive analysis myriad statutes governing marriage 50 states District Columbia  Among findings  Twenty five states set minimum age person get married  eight set age lower 16  Alaska North Carolina  example  set age 14  In New Hampshire it s 13 girls  14 boys  In states  minors certain age   varies state state   must still get judge s approval marry  But report finds hardly robust protection exploitation children  For instance  states specify ruling judge must work court system gives expertise matters   say family  juvenile domestic relations court  Similarly  states require child appointed counsel  Only two state laws specify judge cannot approve marriage solely child s parents consented  And nine states expressly permit pregnancy reason lower minimum marriage age  All problematic makes hard ensure girl isn t pressured marriage family adult partner who  marriage  would subject prosecution statutory rape  What s more  even states officially set age marriage 16 higher  judges generally allowed overrule limit let child marriage go forward  The Tahirih Justice Center hopes report spur lawmakers make changes state s statutes  So far  progress slower advocates would like  But interest issue growing last two years Virginia  Texas New York passed legislation report celebrated putting place  meaningful safeguards  Before New York  marriage formally allowed children young 14  judge s permission  Now   age floor  set 17  even then  approval required judge must determine minor coerced  among criteria  And minor appointed attorney training domestic violence forced marriage

title: Louise Erdrich Delivers A Dystopian Feminist Thriller In  Future Home
text: Louise Erdrich Delivers A Dystopian Feminist Thriller In  Future Home  Before I finally picked read Louise Erdrich s new novel  called Future Home Living God  mighty obstacle faced   obstacle called The Handmaid s Tale  After Margaret Atwood s magisterial achievement  really room another dystopian feminist novel overthrow democracy Christian fundamentalist regime enslaves fertile women reduces simple vessels procreation  The somewhat unsettling answer  Sure  Erdrich reminds us unthinkable could happen variety ways  Rather standing shadow Atwood s classic  Erdrich s tense lyrical new work speculative fiction stands shoulder to braced shoulder right alongside it  Future Home Living God loosely structured series letters heroine  26 year old woman named Cedar Hawk Songmaker  writes unborn child  Cedar impelled write letters because  well  something weird going on  Nature doubled back plants animals fetuses seem randomly devolving  Pregnant women rounded agents new religious government  called  The Church New Constitution  The women give birth prison like maternity hospitals and  afterwards  seems may face future enforced serial pregnancies  But one certain because  one character shrewdly comments   The first thing happens end world don t know happening  Complicating already fraught subject motherhood novel fact Cedar born Ojibwe woman  adopted infant couple refers white  Minneapolis liberals    parents Cedar loves much mocks  Ironically  Cedar Hawk Songmaker recently found name birth plain old Mary Potts  Because she s pregnant  Cedar feels urgency connecting birth mother  She takes road odyssey panicked America people starting hoard cigarettes liquor barter  dumping cell phones laptops  They re returning un hackable modes communication  like passing handwritten notes sending word via Native American network known  the moccasin telegraph  In recent novels like The Plague Doves The Round House  Erdrich edging literary suspense and  boy  achieved mastery pacing  cliffhangers depictions physical violence come handy here  The thing that s ungainly Future Home Living God title  otherwise it s streamlined dystopian thriller  Along series jittery escape fight scenes  Erdrich conjures 12 page description pregnant friend Cedar s  who s hiding cave  goes labor  It s scene that s matchless precision terror  Also scattered throughout breathless novel beautiful meditative passages Cedar  letters baby  considers world gone wrong approaching apocalypse  Here s one  We brief  A one day dandelion  A seedpod skittering across ice  We feather falling wing bird  I don t know given us mortal feel much  It cruel trick  glorious  In postscript  Erdrich tells readers first hatched idea Future Home Living God road trip daughters 2001  Clearly  widespread heightened appreciation The Handmaid s Tale indicates  right cultural moment feminist dystopian fiction  That s good news  least literature

title: GOP Senator Comes Out Against Tax Plan As It Undergoes Changes
text: GOP Senator Comes Out Against Tax Plan As It Undergoes Changes Enlarge image toggle caption J  Scott Applewhite AP J  Scott Applewhite AP Updated 4 58 p m  ET Republicans sprinting push tax plan Congress end year  quick timeline comes breakneck news cycle  The Senate tax overhaul plan underwent big changes overnight  GOP members house confident could get bill passed  But GOP senator saying opposes bill several others uncommitted  could tougher time passing  Senate Finance Committee Chairman Orrin Hatch  R Utah  proposed package sweeping changes  including expanding child tax credit  reducing tax rates income brackets  reducing tax penalty health insurance zero   effectively eliminating Affordable Care Act s individual mandate  Also among proposals  making nearly tax changes individuals temporary  keeping major corporate changes permanent  The cuts individual tax rates  bump standard deduction larger child tax credit  among things   would end end 2025  would proposed tax cuts  pass through  entities   businesses pay taxes individual income tax code  However  many changes corporate side  centered rate cut 35 20 percent  would remain permanent  would proposed elimination individual mandate penalty  Wisconsin Republican Sen  Ron Johnson told Wall Street Journal Wednesday could support bill prioritizes corporations  pass through  businesses  view   He specifically cite Hatch amendments  however  Journal s story  Enlarge image toggle caption Bloomberg via Getty Images Bloomberg via Getty Images The timing changes Hatch proposed could prove key bill s survival  would help tax plan hit targets required Senate rules passage  The Senate already passed budget stipulating cannot add debt  1 5 trillion decade  regulation known Byrd rule also says legislation can t raise deficits past 10 year window  But newest changes  longer term fiscal effects look better Republicans  After increasing deficits 2018 2026  bill would fact modestly subtract deficit 2027  right leaning Tax Foundation s Scott Greenberg noted  That looks good Republicans right now  means bill could continue adding deficit beyond 2027  But also could mean dealing fallout abrupt tax hikes constituents 2026   another  fiscal cliff type standoff end 2025 tax provisions would set expire  Politically  changes mixed bag  Increasing child tax credit current level  1 000  2 000  previously  Senate Republicans proposed increasing  1 650  could make many families happy  Eliminating Obamacare individual mandate likewise would likely please Republicans  base  But recent polling suggests prioritizing corporations  taxes individuals  could tougher sell  Morning Consult Politico found Americans broadly like proposed tax changes  like cutting taxes businesses don t pay corporate rates expanding child tax credit  enthusiastic corporate tax cut  Americans nearly equally split cut  39 percent favor cut 41 percent  the rest said didn t know opinion  Corporate tax cuts are  however  centerpiece Congress White House selling plans  The White House argued corporate tax cut would lead businesses hire pay workers more  tune thousands dollars per year   claim economists across political spectrum said far optimistic  Altogether  Americans don t seem buying line reasoning  Only 36 percent voters believe GOP tax plan lead increase jobs economic growth  52 percent believe it  according new poll Quinnipiac University  There wide partisan split question  78 percent Republicans believe plan lead jobs growth  compared 8 percent Democrats 31 percent independents  These types sharp cutoffs new policies already present tax bills  Both House Senate proposals would allow businesses immediately deduct investments  plans would sunset policy five years  Even conservative economists criticized policy unnecessary already strong economy  potentially creating uncertainty setting future fights Capitol Hill  The House bill also includes  300 credit nonchild dependents  taxpayers spouses would expire five years  Those sorts temporary provisions House bill amount  gimmicks like arbitrary phase ins expirations damage fiscal credibility undermine important objectives  Michael A  Peterson  president CEO Peter G  Peterson Foundation  advocates smaller deficits  said earlier month  Republicans Congress currently racing pass tax legislation end year  Once house passes version tax overhaul  bills would head conference committee  members House Senate would work differences presenting bills final votes then  potentially  sending final product President Trump s desk time Christmas

title: US household debt continues steady rise  NY Fed
text: Total debt held American families jumped  116 billion nearly one percent  13 trillion third quarter  beating April June quarter highest since start global financial crisis 2008  AFP Photo DON EMMERT  New York  AFP    US household debt continued steady rise third quarter  breaking record set previous three months  increasing signs trouble appeared  New York Federal Reserve Bank said Tuesday  Delinquency credit cards auto loans rise  auto loans also continued steady upward climb  hitting second highest level decade  according latest quarterly report  Total debt held American families jumped  116 billion nearly one percent  13 trillion third quarter  beating April June quarter highest since start global financial crisis 2008  The amount debt delinquent   debt payments 90 days late particular attention  delinquency rates rising several years  especially among borrowers lower credit scores  comprises large share total  Auto debt increased  23 billion quarter total  1 2 trillion  credit card debt rose  24 billion  808 billion  statement said  Officials watching signs consumers financial institutions becoming overextended   Delinquency flows across several debt types climbed quarter  including auto loans  said Wilbert van der Klaauw  senior vice president New York Fed  The delinquency rate auto loans edged four percent credit cards rose 7 5 percent  However  mortgage foreclosure rate hit new historical low 69 580 quarter  delinquency rate steady 1 4 percent  For student loans rate held 11 2 percent  Van der Klaauw noted closer look auto loans  revealed notable differences  bank loans auto finance companies  usually car dealers manufacturers  make three quarters auto loans   Delinquency rates among auto finance lenders considerably higher rising  especially subprime borrowers  part reflecting differences underwriting standards  said  The data show trend started four years ago  delinquency rates bank auto loans improved  finance firms slipped  That title: Anthem restricting patients get CT scans MRIs

title: Wrongfully convicted man Wilbert Jones freed 45 years
text: As Wilbert Jones emerged Louisiana prison  free first time 45 years  asked reporter harbors resentment authorities withheld evidence case years ago   I forgave I forgive  Jones said  citing faith God giving hope incarceration  helping focus future  Jones  65  19 police arrested suspicion abducting nurse gunpoint Baton Rouge hospital s parking lot raping behind building night Oct  2  1971  Jones convicted aggravated rape 1974 retrial sentenced life prison without possibility parole  The judge overturned conviction called case Jones  weak  best  noting authorities withheld evidence could exonerated Jones decades ago   Most life taken away something I didn t do  Jones said  moments stepping outside free man first time century   I feel wonderful I thank God opportunity  Jones said   And I thank God legal team  The non profit Innocence Project New Orleans represented Jones since 2003  Jones said plans day included enjoying long awaited meal gumbo potato salad family  His brother  Plem Jones  said he s always known meal would come   I might missed  only  one two visits there  We d sit talk cry together  Plem Jones said   I never gave him  I knew didn t it  matter time  I didn t know when  Though Jones credited faith helping persevere  admitted decades spent prison innocent man easy   It s difficult  I mean very difficult  Jones said  The state s case Jones  rested entirely  nurse s testimony  questionable identification  Jones assailant  judge said  The nurse  died 2008  picked Jones police lineup three months rape  But also told police man raped taller  much rougher  voice Jones had  Jones  lawyers claim nurse s description matches man arrested never charged rape woman abducted parking lot another Baton Rouge hospital  27 days nurse s attack  The man also arrested suspicion raping yet another woman 1973  charged convicted armed robbery case  Anderson said evidence shows police knew similarities man nurse s description attacker   Nevertheless  state failed provide information defense  wrote  Prosecutors  argued state required notify defense information  said ask Louisiana Supreme Court review judge s decision  intend retry Jones

representational election  Moreover  wording bill would provide cutoff late employer could provide information  meaning employer might provide late night election  These limits delays would make text: What started fundraiser William Byrd Marching Band 62 years ago  annual tradition   We five days fun Vinton  said Mary Beth Layman  volunteer Vinton Dogwood Festival  But it s fun springtime event volunteers   I grew Vinton child biggest day  time one day festival  So biggest day town everybody went  enjoyable  Once I graduated college came back home  I wanted keep tradition alive volunteer  that s I ve been  Joey Nicely Vinton said  And several volunteers  like Nicely  come back year year   I helping around 25 years  children grown festival coming it  Layman said  While things little newer  parade mainstay  The William Byrd Marching Band typically leads  last several years  alumni band performs well   I m also alumni band  I play trumpet  Nicely said  But best part whole event   seeing smiles  Events run Sunday  information details events happening  head festival s website  check Vinton Dogwood Festival Facebook page

title: White House releases official portraits President Trump Vice President Pence
text: The White House released official portraits President Donald Trump Vice President Mike Pence Tuesday  The two smiling photos  captured front American flag  Trump wearing blue tie Pence red one  White House photographers Shealah Craighead Myles Cullen made photos Trump Pence  respectively  The photos traditionally hung government buildings across country U S  embassies world wide  The release comes nine months pair sworn in  time spaces occupied empty picture frames  Trump sat official portrait January  according White House schedule  The White House explaining delay release

text: Augusta Health opening new multispecialty clinic near Lexington  Located next Rockbridge County High School  center provide facilities 12 specialties  well labs X Ray facilities  It s first free standing specialty clinic Augusta   It s practical  it s efficient  says Sylvia Bailey  Practice Administrator Augusta Health   And it s less time   less time patient try get work  get driver  try drive Fishersville  The freshly renovated building ribbon cutting weekend  starts seeing patients Wednesday

title: Check freezer  Huge frozen food recall
text: Get ready check freezer  That huge frozen food recall growing products date back far 2014  It includes millions packages fruits vegetables shipped 50 states Canada Mexico  The problem listeria includes 400 products sold 40 different brand names  The product originated CRF foods Pasco  Washington  Some products sold Kroger Target stores  well Trader Joes  The recall also involves prepared frozen foods include vegetables burritos fried rice  Here you re advised do  click list recalled products  check freezer  If find foods affected throw out  For information  click links  Related Links

text: Authorities said man serving life sentence murdering two day old baby found dead U K  prison cell weekend  Liam Deane  22  jailed October punching  shaking squeezing baby girl death wouldn t stop crying  found dead cell HM Prison Leeds England Sunday  The Yorkshire Evening Post reported  RELATED  Click outrageous mugshots crimes Deane admitted murdering daughter  Luna  mother sleeping family home Wakefield  England  last July  He reportedly lost temper night subjected daughter brutal attack  The baby died intensive care suffering  catastrophic brain injuries  father  SEE ALSO   Good girl  cheerleader charged killing burying infant As result  Deane sentenced life prison could served minimum 10 years  Another inmate  John Westland  28  charged Deane s murder court Tuesday held custody  It remains unclear Westland originally admitted jail

title: Virginia s first responders user recent events train emergencies
text: This year certainly seen number major emergencies   including intense hurricanes  wildfires  mass shootings violent protests  But Virginia s emergency management leaders using incidents prepare complex situations  First responders like firefighter Chris Dean used quiet week  But Dean s taking advantage educational opportunity learn foundations emergency management   The building partnerships networking listening experiences localities tremendous  Dean said  He s joined week firefighters  paramedics  dispatch HAZMAT crews around region specialized course basic emergency management  hosted state s Department Emergency Management  They re learning everything address media emergency situations unique capabilities fire rescue boat   Emergencies getting complex course they re taking threats  said Jeff Caldwell  Director External Affairs Virginia Department Emergency Management  Caldwell said class great making Virginia specific preparations  But it s also great getting whole state page comes preparing responding emergencies   What recognize complex threats require cooperating multiple agencies local  state  federal level  said  Those complex threats include year s destructive hurricanes  terror attacks  Charlottesville protests  helping shape curriculum emergency management training classes   These types local protests become big quickly  noted  Dean said he s glad week he s ab e meet key partners rely future incidents   We pick phone make phone call get guidance  Dean said   And that s basis emergency management able share information back forth  Dean said he s also enjoyed conversations peers talking address possible emergencies passenger rail  especially since Amtrak back Roanoke  But looking toward future  Caldwell said they ll focused preparing natural disasters  cyber attacks  civil unrest  complex terror attacks

title: Australian voters approve gay marriage
text: FINALLY  voting lasted two months  November 15th brought result  To question  Should law changed allow same sex couples marry  almost 62  Australians said yes  38  said no  The Yes vote prevailed six Australia s states two big territories  Barely hiding sense relief  triumph  Malcolm Turnbull  prime minister  called result  overwhelming  He promised parliamentary vote legalise gay marriage would follow Christmas  At rallies around country  supporters change cheered prospect  But issue long divided Mr Turnbull s conservative Liberal Party  The Marriage Act originally left title: Hybrid models changing piano market
text: HYBRID rage  Buyers want reliability beauty traditional product also keen flexibility  cost effectiveness modernity provided electric innovations  With hybrid  ways  We are  course  talking title: Can Roy Moore Still Win
text: The alleged child molester Democrat  Alabama voters face choice weeks  time  it s clear they ll find odious  There several reasons think Roy Moore  Republican nominee who s accused making sexual advances teenagers  could lose special Senate election scheduled Dec  12  But there s one big reason think could still win  Washington Republicans always leery Moore  crusading Christian conservative twice elected Alabama supreme court and twice booted refusing abide higher courts  rulings Ten Commandments same sex marriage  But recent revelations Moore  dated  girls young 14 unmarried local prosecutor 30s sent national GOP moral political panic  Moore denied allegations five women  including one said assaulted locked car 16  In defense  said didn t recall  dating girl without permission mother  Alabama overwhelmingly Republican state President Trump got 62  vote  But Moore universally popular two election wins might suggest  He previously lost two Republican gubernatorial primaries  last judicial election got 52  vote  under performing year s GOP presidential nominee  Mitt Romney  9 points  Moore committed base religious voters  particularly rural Alabama  But I traveled state earlier year  I found many business minded Republicans suburban areas disliked Moore s disregard legal authority extreme positions social issues  Some fretted Moore validates worst stereotypes outsiders hold Alabamans bunch barefoot  Bible thumping rednecks  A GOP strategist following race says private polling showed within margin error even allegations sexual impropriety  The Republican National Committee National Republican Senatorial Committee cut ties Moore proof  says  threat D C  Establishment  But Moore s bluster  poorly funded  skimpily staffed campaign may struggle without institutional support  That happened 2012 Senate campaign Missouri Republican Todd Akin  lost red state 16 points said  legitimate rape  unlikely cause pregnancy backers bailed  In Akin race  many Republican voters decided would rather elect Democrat someone regarded misogynist  The question Alabama whether enough Republican voters believe accusations find serious enough override partisanship  There s evidence happen  The current Democratic governor Louisiana  John Bel Edwards  2015 then Sen  David Vitter acknowledged patronizing prostitutes   That election also proof Democrats turn vote off year elections  Even South  plenty voters preferred Democrat scoundrel  There s big caveat hangs post 2016 political analysis  however  Donald Trump  The President s rise scuttled much old conventional wisdom voters behave  It revealed change way religious right voters judge character candidates  Six years ago  30  white evangelical voters believed candidate acted immorally private could still behave ethically office  according Public Religion Research Institute  Asked last fall  72  thought candidates  private morals irrelevant  What happened between  course  Trump  White evangelical voters backed huge majority 2016  rationalizing louche personal life boasts sexually assaulting women Access Hollywood tape  Evangelical leaders like Jerry Falwell Jr  argued God chose mysterious instruments work His will  immoral people could still govern morally U S  faced spiritual crisis Trump could deliver nation  Polls Alabama show close race  neither candidate topping 50  The Democrat Doug Jones well credentialed former prosecutor begun airing ads Moore allegations   There plenty Republicans Alabama don t like Roy Moore  says David Mowery  Montgomery based independent consultant   Will actually hold nose vote Democrat  In age Trump  that s harder judgment ever make  Correction  The original version story misstated results survey Public Religion Research Institute  PRRI said six years ago 30  white evangelical voters believed candidate acted immorally private could still behave ethically office compared 72  said last fall  72  six years ago 30  last fall

title: The extraordinary silliness American college grading
text: Imagine marathon runners ranked simply taking average time every course  Some courses clearly harder others  runners choose races enter  runner could always improve ranking refusing run difficult courses  Even sillier would rank runners average finish position across races  world class professional could run high schoolers finish first without even trying  Strangely  current system evaluating American college students manages achieve extraordinary level silliness  Since students select courses  grades courses count equally  rewarded taking easier courses punished taking harder ones  A first year student taking introductory English literature gets exactly equal credit classmate precociously jumps graduate level literary analysis  College grade point averages   GPA s  merely matter pride  Medical schools  law schools consulting firms  among popular post graduation destinations  strict GPA cut offs  student fails make grade struggle application even seen human  From individual student s standpoint  it s completely rational optimise GPA   even expense considerations  From university s point view  though  expense vast  That s running race exists test current ability  training happened long before  College  contrast  supposed place training actually happens  That makes college GPA significantly worse imagined marathon ranking  If believe that  even occasionally  taking harder course would help student learn more  GPA system incentivises students take courses they ll learn less  In words  believe college helps make people smarter  GPA system makes us collectively dumber  Universities certainly shown concern GPA past  Princeton University Wellesley College  among others  spent decade experimenting policies curb grade inflation  mandating fixed cap number A grades cap average GPA courses  But inflation curbing policies help equalise difficulty various different courses  don t change incentive student take easiest courses possible  And always way find easier courses  In college professors grade discretion  might known grading generously  But even universities enforced grading standards  different courses necessarily attract students different levels ability  students intermediate course always tougher competition students introductory class  And courses easier specific students  even they re easy students whole  it s uncommon Ivy League schools see fluent foreign language speakers feign degree ignorance order take introductory language courses they ll get perfect grades minimal effort  There two potential solutions general class problems  One create standardised test students must take  thereby making outcomes directly comparable  This happened high school level  better worse  scholastic aptitude tests   SAT s  reading  writing maths  students take assessment  resulting scores directly comparable  However  university level  seems implausible imagine students across different specialties taking single  unified test  The solution find way compare calibrate different grades different courses  Over years  many academics   including Valen Johnson  Duke University  Jonathan Caulkins co authors Carnegie Mellon   proposed methods would try control differences instructor grading different levels student ability  The correction instructor stringency relies idea instructors  implicitly  ranking students top bottom  regardless grade cut offs use  If adjust rankings  compare instructors give different grades  The correction student ability relies tracking students across various courses  inferring average student ability course result  The adjusted GPA measures reward students getting good grades taking difficult courses   short  working learning much possible  At time Johnson s proposal 1997  Duke University briefly flirted implementing alternative GPA  as supplement traditional GPA   rambunctious public consultation proposal narrowly defeated faculty vote  The opposition mostly came students members humanities departments  worried courses would deemed less demanding  As far I tell  university ever implemented alternative GPA   One sad feature college GPA situation many parties responding rationally incentives face  Students facing GPA cutoffs behaving rationally taking easier courses better grades  even would prefer take harder courses system didn t punish choice  Graduate schools employers might think GPA critically flawed metric student ability  still end using want better alternatives  Individual professors get better student evaluations easier lives grade generously  can t individually correct differences course difficulty anyway

title: The Troubling Link Between Domestic Violence Mass Shooters
text: There explanation slaughter church  A shooter s mind unsolvable riddle  nobody predict odd loner turn sociopath  angry outburst presages massacre  But hindsight  often red flags  Devin Patrick Kelley displayed plenty them  He mental health problems  history animal cruelty domestic violence conviction prevented getting gun  But got one anyway  Actually  got four  On Nov  5  Kelley  26  drove First Baptist Church tiny Sutherland Springs  Texas  wife s family worshipped  He fired assault style rifle congregation full children grandparents  killing 26 people injuring 20 more  Survivors said prowled aisle looking shoot crying babies mothers huddled pews  Among dead  toddler  pastor s daughter  two first time attendees unborn child  It massacre could never predicted  But perhaps could prevented  Like convicted domestic abusers  Kelley supposed access firearms  But Air Force acknowledged wake shooting appeared Kelley s domestic violence conviction wasn t entered National Crime Information Center  NCIC  database  likely able pass background check  This hardly isolated error  According Florida International University report obtained TIME  military mishandled roughly 1 300 domestic violence cases 2004 2012  including misclassifications allowed abusers go unreported NCIC   There thousands cases misclassified  says Eric Carpenter  associate professor FIU former Army lawyer spent years sifting military court martial data   We know one  Kelley  decided shoot church  The problem runs deeper poor record keeping  Federal law prohibits anyone convicted domestic violence subject domestic violence restraining order owning gun  But spotty enforcement allow abusers fall cracks  While 28 states Washington  D C  laws prohibiting convicted domestic batterers buying possessing firearms  14 require give guns already own  Some laws say domestic violence restrictions apply spouse  cohabitating partner co parent  creating so called boyfriend loophole excludes casual partners  There three main background check databases reporting crimes  states differ report cases  Some states  like New York  New Mexico Louisiana  reported thousands domestic violence restraining orders National Instant Criminal Background Check System Indices  NICS Indices  December 2016  33 states reported none all  Mourners gathered Nov  6 prayer service 26 victims Sutherland Springs Scott Olson Getty Images Kelley kind guy never passed background check  In 2012  wife Tessa Kelley accused beating her  choking her  threatening gun hitting infant son hard enough break skull  Kelley charged domestic violence military court sent mental hospital New Mexico  briefly escaped facility  Former hospital staffers say hoarded firearms made death threats military superiors  suffered unspecified mental disorder  Later year  pleaded guilty domestic violence charges spent year brig receiving  bad conduct  discharge Air Force  Once out  Kelley didn t clean act  In 2013  Comal County sheriff s office investigated complaint rape sexual assault New Braunfels  Texas  Kelley never charged  When lived Colorado 2014  neighbors called police witnessed beating dog  cited animal cruelty  That year  sheriffs responded domestic violence call Kelley s home checked girlfriend  left without filing charges  That girlfriend  Danielle Shields  became wife soon afterward  In recent months  Kelley s social media accounts grown darker  He lost job security guard July  It seemed like going romantic breakup  He posted pictures guns online  He sent threatening texts mother in law  It church Sutherland Springs targeted massacre  Texas officials called  domestic situation  Which isn t surprising either  A majority mass shootings 2009 2016 involved domestic family violence  according analysis gun violence prevention group Everytown Gun Safety  The group found 54  incidents four people  not including shooter  killed firearm  intimate partner family member among victims  Most mass shootings happened home  But TIME analysis Everytown s data found 46 mass shootings took place entirely public since 2009  33  shooters reported history violence women  James Hodgkinson  injured Republican Representative Steve Scalise Louisiana several others opened fire congressional baseball practice June  arrested 2006 hitting choking foster daughter  Omar Mateen  killed 49 people Pulse nightclub massacre Orlando 2016  abused ex wife  Robert Dear  killed three people wounded nine others opened fire Planned Parenthood clinic Colorado 2015  accused domestic violence two ex wives  But scientific terms  link remains anecdotal  Just mass shooters often abusers doesn t mean abusers likely mass shooters  That s red flags appear hindsight  researchers lack sufficient evidence prove connection ahead time   Right don t enough data pattern  says Susan B  Sorenson  professor University Pennsylvania director Ortner Center Family Violence  Gun rights advocates use uncertainty argue tougher restrictions gun access domestic abusers unnecessary  But logic doesn t hold either   The one thing know  mass shooters  common access massive firepower  says Sorensen   That s single unifying force  Keeping guns domestic abusers rare subject Republicans Democrats mostly agree   There enormous problems background check system  says Senator John Cornyn Texas  Republican Senator Jeff Flake teaming Democratic Senator Martin Heinrich introduce bill would require military accurately record report domestic violence convictions  And Republican governors Utah  North Dakota  Wisconsin Michigan taken steps limit gun rights domestic batterers  Experts say laws require abusers surrender guns particularly effective  States implemented relinquishment laws saw 14  decline intimate partner gun homicides  according researchers Boston University Duke University  Nobody could predicted latest massacre  But laws prevent people like Kelley getting gun  If would enforce them   With reporting W J title: Reuters
The Troubling Link Between Domestic Violence Mass Shooters
text: There explanation slaughter church  A shooter s mind unsolvable riddle  nobody predict odd loner turn sociopath  angry outburst presages massacre  But hindsight  often red flags  Devin Patrick Kelley displayed plenty them  He mental health problems  history animal cruelty domestic violence conviction prevented getting gun  But got one anyway  Actually  got four  On Nov  5  Kelley  26  drove First Baptist Church tiny Sutherland Springs  Texas  wife s family worshipped  He fired assault style rifle congregation full children grandparents  killing 26 people injuring 20 more  Survivors said prowled aisle looking shoot crying babies mothers huddled pews  Among dead  toddler  pastor s daughter  two first time attendees unborn child  It massacre could never predicted  But perhaps could prevented  Like convicted domestic abusers  Kelley supposed access firearms  But Air Force acknowledged wake shooting appeared Kelley s domestic violence conviction wasn t entered National Crime Information Center  NCIC  database  likely able pass background check  This hardly isolated error  According Florida International University report obtained TIME  military mishandled roughly 1 300 domestic violence cases 2004 2012  including misclassifications allowed abusers go unreported NCIC   There thousands cases misclassified  says Eric Carpenter  associate professor FIU former Army lawyer spent years sifting military court martial data   We know one  Kelley  decided shoot church  The problem runs deeper poor record keeping  Federal law prohibits anyone convicted domestic violence subject domestic violence restraining order owning gun  But spotty enforcement allow abusers fall cracks  While 28 states Washington  D C  laws prohibiting convicted domestic batterers buying possessing firearms  14 require give guns already own  Some laws say domestic violence restrictions apply spouse  cohabitating partner co parent  creating so called boyfriend loophole excludes casual partners  There three main background check databases reporting crimes  states differ report cases  Some states  like New York  New Mexico Louisiana  reported thousands domestic violence restraining orders National Instant Criminal Background Check System Indices  NICS Indices  December 2016  33 states reported none all  Mourners gathered Nov  6 prayer service 26 victims Sutherland Springs Scott Olson Getty Images Kelley kind guy never passed background check  In 2012  wife Tessa Kelley accused beating her  choking her  threatening gun hitting infant son hard enough break skull  Kelley charged domestic violence military court sent mental hospital New Mexico  briefly escaped facility  Former hospital staffers say hoarded firearms made death threats military superiors  suffered unspecified mental disorder  Later year  pleaded guilty domestic violence charges spent year brig receiving  bad conduct  discharge Air Force  Once out  Kelley didn t clean act  In 2013  Comal County sheriff s office investigated complaint rape sexual assault New Braunfels  Texas  Kelley never charged  When lived Colorado 2014  neighbors called police witnessed beating dog  cited animal cruelty  That year  sheriffs responded domestic violence call Kelley s home checked girlfriend  left without filing charges  That girlfriend  Danielle Shields  became wife soon afterward  In recent months  Kelley s social media accounts grown darker  He lost job security guard July  It seemed like going romantic breakup  He posted pictures guns online  He sent threatening texts mother in law  It church Sutherland Springs targeted massacre  Texas officials called  domestic situation  Which isn t surprising either  A majority mass shootings 2009 2016 involved domestic family violence  according analysis gun violence prevention group Everytown Gun Safety  The group found 54  incidents four people  not including shooter  killed firearm  intimate partner family member among victims  Most mass shootings happened home  But TIME analysis Everytown s data found 46 mass shootings took place entirely public since 2009  33  shooters reported history violence women  James Hodgkinson  injured Republican Representative Steve Scalise Louisiana several others opened fire congressional baseball practice June  arrested 2006 hitting choking foster daughter  Omar Mateen  killed 49 people Pulse nightclub massacre Orlando 2016  abused ex wife  Robert Dear  killed three people wounded nine others opened fire Planned Parenthood clinic Colorado 2015  accused domestic violence two ex wives  But scientific terms  link remains anecdotal  Just mass shooters often abusers doesn t mean abusers likely mass shooters  That s red flags appear hindsight  researchers lack sufficient evidence prove connection ahead time   Right don t enough data pattern  says Susan B  Sorenson  professor University Pennsylvania director Ortner Center Family Violence  Gun rights advocates use uncertainty argue tougher restrictions gun access domestic abusers unnecessary  But logic doesn t hold either   The one thing know  mass shooters  common access massive firepower  says Sorensen   That s single unifying force  Keeping guns domestic abusers rare subject Republicans Democrats mostly agree   There enormous problems background check system  says Senator John Cornyn Texas  Republican Senator Jeff Flake teaming Democratic Senator Martin Heinrich introduce bill would require military accurately record report domestic violence convictions  And Republican governors Utah  North Dakota  Wisconsin Michigan taken steps limit gun rights domestic batterers  Experts say laws require abusers surrender guns particularly effective  States implemented relinquishment laws saw 14  decline intimate partner gun homicides  according researchers Boston University Duke University  Nobody could predicted latest massacre  But laws prevent people like Kelley getting gun  If would enforce them   With reporting W J  HENNIGAN NASH JENKINS WASHINGTON ABIGAIL ABRAMS NEW YORK This appears November 20  2017 issue TIME

title: Rising Teen Suicides Social Media Use  Is There Link
text: TIME Health For more  visit TIME Health  CHICAGO    An increase suicide rates among U S  teens occurred time social media use surged new analysis suggests may link  Suicide rates teens rose 2010 2015 declined nearly two decades  according data federal Centers Disease Control Prevention  Why rates went isn t known  The study doesn t answer question  suggests one factor could rising social media use  Recent teen suicides blamed cyberbullying  social media posts depicting  perfect  lives may taking toll teens  mental health  researchers say   After hours scrolling Instagram feeds  I feel worse I feel left out  said Caitlin Hearty  17 year old Littleton  Colorado  high school senior helped organize offline campaign last month several local teen suicides   No one posts bad things they re going through  said Chloe Schilling  also 17  helped campaign  hundreds teens agreed use internet social media one month  The study s authors looked CDC suicide reports 2009 15 results two surveys given U S  high school students measure attitudes  behaviors interests  About half million teens ages 13 18 involved  They asked use electronic devices  social media  print media  television time spent friends  Questions mood included frequency feeling hopeless considering attempting suicide  The researchers didn t examine circumstances surrounding individual suicides  Dr  Christine Moutier  chief medical officer American Foundation Suicide Prevention  said study provides weak evidence popular theory many factors influence teen suicide  The study published Tuesday journal Clinical Psychological Science  Data highlighted study include   Teens  use electronic devices including smartphones least five hours daily doubled  8 percent 2009 19 percent 2015  These teens 70 percent likely suicidal thoughts actions reported one hour daily use   In 2015  36 percent teens reported feeling desperately sad hopeless  thinking about  planning attempting suicide  32 percent 2009  For girls  rates higher   45 percent 2015 versus 40 percent 2009   In 2009  58  12th grade girls used social media every day nearly every day  2015  87  used social media every day nearly every day  They 14  likely depressed used social media less frequently   We need stop thinking smartphones harmless  said study author Jean Twenge  psychology professor San Diego State University studies generational trends   There s tendency say   Oh  teens communicating friends  Monitoring kids  use smartphones social media important  setting reasonable limits  said  Dr  Victor Strasburger  teen medicine specialist University New Mexico  said study implies connection teen suicides  depression social media  It shows need research new technology  Strasburger said  He noted skeptics think social media unfairly criticized compare so called vices past generations   When dime store books came out  comic books came out  television came out  rock roll first started  people saying  This end world  With immediacy  anonymity  potential bullying  social media unique potential causing real harm  said   Parents don t really get that  Strasburger said  ___ AP reporter P  Solomon Banda contributed story Littleton  Colorado

title: Commentary  Whose Catalonia coup anyway
text: For hundreds thousands marchers thronging palace lined streets Barcelona Sunday  one answer question storied Barcelona  capital Catalonia  really belonged   Viva Espaa  chanted  waving flags emblazoned regal lions banners read  We part Spain  Pro independence marchers wave Catalan flags Barcelona s Sant Jaume Square Catalan regional parliament declared independence Spain  October 27  2017  REUTERS Yves Herman Just 36 hours earlier  city filled nearly many rival activists   time waving uni starred flags  yelling  Viva la Repblica Catalana  show support Catalan Republic  new  sovereign country theoretically created Catalonia s autonomous provincial government Friday controversially declared free Spain  In time two marches  Spain s conservative Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy dismissed Catalonia s independence declaration  null void  fired Catalonia cabinet  dissolved Catalonia s parliament  called new elections  announced central government stepping oversee regional authorities  Friday held substantial powers self rule  Rajoy s action  declared Catalonia Vice President Oriol Junqueras   coup d tat  directed  anti democratic  prime minister Madrid   The president country Carles Puigdemont  said Junqueras  referring Catalonia s regional president piece newspaper El Punt Avui  Junqueras correct one thing  coup indeed rattled province  But instigators aren t Madrid  Despite appearing rigidly authoritarian  Rajoy Spanish law  courts  national Senate  king  1978 constitution solidly backing actions lassoing runaway Catalonia back Spain  It Spanish government  separatists Catalonia  July poll showed 41 percent wanted independence 49 percent wanted stay Spain  undermining democracy land  Junqueras  Puigdemont social media savvy band separatists  leveraged historical grudges create rancor division  making mockery democracy claim desire saying it s Spain  elections  healthy constitution  decentralized government  undemocratic  Puigdemont  avowed independence supporter onetime mayor Girona  unelected appointee regional president s seat Jan  2016  chosen parliamentary coalition shared little desire separatism  Dubbed  the accidental president  became first leader Catalonia refuse pledge loyalty Spain s constitution king  Filling cabinet like minded members  Puigdemont Junqueras emphasized independence promised referendum leaving Spain  However  Spain s constitution  approved 90 percent Catalan voters 1978  holds regions secede Spanish voters approve it  In spite that  Puigdemont ignored Rajoy s warnings Constitutional Court s ruling vote independence unconstitutional illegal  Supporters Spanish unity march central Barcelona  Spain  October 29  2017  REUTERS Jon Nazca For months  separatist faction Barcelona based government made misleading promises  An independent Catalonia would remain European Union  said   even though EU said declaring independence would effectively resigning group  A report regional Ministry Economy  headed Junqueras  concluded international investment would rise wealthy Catalonia would remain economically viable despite warnings major businesses they d move headquarters  perhaps relocate entirely independence declared  Separatists riled populace fervent rallies  claimed national government Madrid robbing Catalonia  depicting Catalans victimized oppressed  On Sept 7  secessionist camp parliament pushed bill holding referendum ignoring standard procedure  including discussion advance notice would agenda  While 52 135 parliamentarians left disgust  bill passed 72 votes  Puigdemont Junqueras appeared revel calls Rajoy drop plebiscite scheduled Oct  1  perhaps realizing move national government would seen Goliath stomping David  On count  right  Instead ignoring it  Madrid sent national police try prevent vote taking place  The police largely unsuccessful attempt short lived  images battering doors  knocking elderly  dragging voters stairs  pulling women hair shooting civilians rubber bullets alarm world rally support separatist call advertising campaign could achieved  Later reports showed number injuries  initially thought 800  exaggerated  reports victimization  Missing dramatic imagery beamed worldwide fact disorganized vote marred violence  Madrid tried shut voting stations  basic polling safeguards overlooked Catalan government announced regardless registration  Catalans could cast ballots anywhere   creating potential repeat voting  Since voters warned Madrid referendum illegal  largely boycotted wanted stay Spain  2 million Catalans 5 million plus potential voters cast ballots  Despite low turnout allegations voter fraud  Catalan government hailed result 90 percent vote independence  After nearly four weeks double speak canceled announcements independence   1 000 businesses moved headquarters outside Catalonia tourism plummeted   Puigdemont referred issue regional parliament  held secret ballot Oct 27  Of 135 parliamentarians  70 wrote yes  10 wrote no  rest stormed out  Many left Spanish flags empty chairs  Before hour out  Spain s Senate Madrid agreed invoke constitution s never before used Article 155  giving Madrid authority suspend Catalonia s government  Hours later  Rajoy announced central government taking over  Puigdemont  Junqueras Catalan cabinet members may face charges rebellion  sedition misuse public funds  Puigdemont slipped Brussels  Belgian lawyer says return Spain  Junqueras still wants tackle creation new republic  writing New York Times op ed column published Wednesday Catalonia would retreat   In battle self determination recognition rights  one win first punch  said  It uphill battle even unlikely event central government lets Junqueras stay office  A new poll  published El Mundo  shows number Catalans supporting independence dropped 33 percent   Melissa Rossi  lives Barcelona  author  What Every American Should Know  geopolitical book series Plume Penguin   melissarossi199

PUNTO 1 Titoli Stato Italia  portafoglio esteri scende da massimo novembre 2016
text: Aggiunge dettagli  tabella  MILANO  15 novembre  Reuters    Scende agosto dal massimo da novembre 2016 toccato il mese precedente il controvalore dei titoli di Stato italiani detenuti da investitori esteri  Secondo dati del fascicolo  Finanza pubblica  fabbisogno e debito  diffuso da Banca d Italia  il portafoglio esteri risultava pari 667 760 miliardi di euro contro 686 912 di fine luglio  dato rivisto rispetto ai 687 061 miliardi indicati un mese fa  Quello di luglio era stato il livello pi alto dai 700 998 miliardi di novembre dell anno scorso  In base calcoli Reuters sui dati di via Nazionale  agosto la quota dei governativi italiani mano ai non residenti  scesa al 34 7  del totale dei titoli circolazione  dal 35 3  del mese precedente  Il portafoglio esteri include anche governativi detenuti da investitori domestici attraverso soggetti non residenti  come gestioni patrimoniali e fondi  direttamente dall Eurosistema  e non attraverso Bankitalia  e da banche centrali di altri Paesi  Nella sua ultima relazione annuale Bankitalia ha confermato che fine 2016 la differenza tra la quota esteri vera e propria e il dato  lordo  fornito mensilmente resta grossomodo intorno ai 10 punti percentuali  26 7  contro 36 1  Segue tabella con il dettaglio dei dati  agosto 2017 luglio 2017 mld euro     mld euro     Banca d Italia 334 083   17 4 328 517   16 9 Banche italiane 373 263   19 4 375 377   19 3 Assicur Fondi 422 108   21 9 426 217   21 9 Retail 127 302   6 6 130 536   6 7 Esteri 667 760   34 7 686 912   35 3 Totale 1 924 516 1 947 560 Il calo della posizione degli esteri agosto  stato il pi significativo tra tutte le categorie di investitori  sia termini assoluti  oltre 19 miliardi  sia relativi  0 6 punti percentuali  un mese che ha registrato una riduzione dei titoli di Stato circolazione di circa 23 miliardi  Una riduzione legata alla cancellazione da parte del Tesoro di alcune aste estive  che ha prodotto agosto un offerta netta di governativi negativa per quasi 24 miliardi  La salita del debito Target2 dell Italia registrata agosto  16 4 miliardi quota 414 2  conferma come il calo delle emissioni nette nel corso del mese sia risultato principalmente proprio una riduzione delle posizioni degli investitori esteri titoli di Stato italiani  Cali pi limitati sono stati registrati dai portafogli di assicurazione e fondi  4 1 miliardi circa  investitori retail  3 2 miliardi  e banche italiane  2 1 miliardi  QUOTA BANKITALIA Continua invece ad ampliarsi il portafoglio di Bankitalia  di pari passo all avanzamento del Qe  5 5 miliardi  al 17 4  del totale  I dati diffusi oggi indicano peraltro che il trend  proseguito settembre  341 589 miliardi  il 17 7  In settembre inoltre l importo complessivo dei titoli di Stato italiani circolazione  tornato salire leggermente   1 8 miliardi quota 1 926 322  Bankitalia fornisce dati sul totale dei titoli e sulla propria posizione aggiornati gi al mese successivo  Per una panoramica su mercati e notizie lingua italiana con quotazioni  grafici e dati  gli abbonati Eikon possono digitare nel Search Box di Eikon  Pagina Italia   Panorama Italia  Sul sito www reuters it le altre notizie Reuters italiano  Le top news anche su www twitter com reuters_italia

title: Presidente peruano Kuczynski rejeita acusaes de ter trabalhado para Odebrecht
text: LIMA  Reuters    O presidente Peru  Pedro Pablo Kuczynski  garantiu nesta quarta feira que  falsa acusao de que construtora brasileira Odebrecht  envolvida em diversos escndalos de corrupo na Amrica Latina  contratou como consultor financeiro h uma dcada  Kuczynski acena durante reunio Vietn 11 11 2017 REUTERS Jorge Silva Em uma breve mensagem televisionada  nao  Kuczynski negou ter recebido dinheiro da Odebrecht em suas campanhas para eleies presidenciais de 2011 e 2016  O maior jornal Peru  El Comercio  relatou na segunda feira que ex presidente da companhia brasileira Marcelo Odebrecht acusou Kuczynski de ter trabalhado para construtora aps governo de Alejandro Toledo  2001 2006  quando Kuczynski foi um dos ministros da Economia  De acordo com jornal  Marcelo Odebrecht  que foi interrogado por promotores peruanos Brasil  destacou que empresa brasileira havia financiado campanhas de candidatos presidenciais peruanos   Afirma que depois de ter sido ministro  contratou como consultor financeiro de tal empresa  Esta suposta afirmao tambm  falsa  disse Kuczynski   No recebi nenhum repasse de tal empresa em nenhuma de minhas campanhas eleitorais  acrescentou presidente peruano  de 79 anos  A Reuters no conseguiu confirmar que Marcelo Odebrecht disse promotores peruanos em Curitiba   Como chefe de Estado  apoio luta contra corrupo em todos os seus nveis  afirmou Kuczynski    fundamental que todos lutem contra corrupo  esta luta tem meu compromisso  Kuczunski  que assumiu em julho ano passado em mandato de cinco anos  rejeitou qualquer vnculo profissional com Odebrecht  mbito de uma investigao realizada pelo Congresso dominado pela oposio

title: Presidente francs Macron convida premi libans Hariri e famlia  Frana
text: PARIS  Reuters    O primeiro ministro Lbano  Saad al Hariri  e sua famlia iro viajar  Frana nos prximos dias  disse uma fonte presidencial francesa nesta quarta feira  aps presidente Emmanuel Macron convid lo como parte de esforos para diminuir tenses Oriente Mdio  Falando na cidade alem de Bonn aps uma conferncia sobre clima  Macron disse que seu convite no  uma oferta de exlio para Hariri  que anunciou sua abrupta renncia como premi h 11 dias da capital saudita  Riad  O presidente Lbano  Michel Aoun  que se recusou aceitar renncia primeiro ministro  acusou mais cedo nesta quarta feira os sauditas de tornarem Hariri refm   e chamou isto de um ato de agresso  Perguntado se estava oferecendo exlio Hariri  Macron disse   No  de maneira alguma  Eu espero que Lbano seja estvel e que escolhas polticas estejam de acordo com normas institucionais   Ns precisamos de um Lbano forte com sua integridade territorial respeitada  Ns precisamos de lderes que sejam livres para fazer suas prprias escolhas e falar livremente  A Frana possui relaes prximas com Lbano  que esteve sob controle francs entre guerras mundiais  e com Hariri  que possui uma casa na Frana e passou diversos anos pas  Seu pai  Rafik  era amigo prximo ex presidente Jacques Chirac  O convite de Macron aconteceu aps conversar tanto com prncipe saudita Mohammed bin Salman quanto com Hariri por telefone  informou Eliseu em comunicado  A Arbia Saudita negou ter detido Hariri ou coagido ele renunciar  Uma fonte Palcio Eliseu disse que Hariri deve desembarcar na Frana  nos prximos dias   REPENTINO  A oferta da Frana aparentou ter sido de ltimo minuto  sem indcios de autoridades francesas nesta manh de que isto era programado  Um porta voz governo francs em entrevista coletiva semanal at mesmo pediu para Hariri voltar Beirute para entregar sua renncia  Diplomatas franceses em Paris aparentavam ter sido pegos de surpresa  Eles disseram que Macron havia encontrado uma maneira de tirar Hariri da Arbia Saudita sem perdas para nenhum lado  mas questionaram como isto ir funcionar longo prazo   Isto foi repentino  disse um diplomata   O presidente quer diminuir tenses  mas ns tambm estamos em crculos  Estamos somente herdando os problemas

title: How Use Instant Pot
text: Karsten Moran The New York Times How Does Pressure Cooker Work  Dating 17th century  first pressurized cooking pot developed French physicist Denis Papin  Basically pot tight sealing lid steam valve  pressure cooker traps steam rising boiling liquid pot  which  turn  raises temperature liquid boils   For example  without pressure  water sea level boils 212 degrees  Under pressure  temperature rise much 266 degrees  The higher temperature  combined pressure pot forces hot steam ingredients  cooks food much faster traditional methods  A pressure cooker works different pressure levels  one changing boiling point liquid  With pressure cookers today  pressure gauge preset two options  At low pressure  10 pounds per square inch  p s i  internal temperature reaches 235 degrees  At high pressure  15 pounds p s i  reach 250 degrees  A steam valve allows excess steam escape  keeping pressure cooker exploding  but  countless tales split pea soups ceiling attest  historically imperfect method  Modern pressure cookers   stovetop electric   quite safe  They don t explode grandmother s may have  But  eliminating guesswork  electric pressure cookers take anxiety process  For long time  stovetop pressure cookers style available  As name suggests  they re heated stove  set high low pressure  As pressure inside increases  gauge lid pops up  indicating inside pot reached optimal pressure  Once there  heat needs adjusted keep pot s temperature pressure constant  This avoid over pressurizing  which burn food inside or  extreme cases  explode  It also keeps pressure temperature falling food done  Monitoring pressure isn t hard  need keep eye it  With electric pressure cooker  everything done automatically  Once reaches correct pressure temperature  stay without cook s anything  For reason  set walk away  much would slow cooker  And don t worry  It won t explode  It simply turn pressure temperature ever rise high  Karsten Moran The New York Times Using Your Electric Pressure Cooker Check recipe  set device correct pressure level  high low  add amount time you d like things cook  High pressure used recipes  low used often quicker cooking delicate ingredients  like seafood  custards  rice dishes eggs  Once device set  clock won t immediately begin count down  The pot must first build pressure  Depending contents  take 5 20 minutes  Always double check steam valve locked  sealed position   Incorrectly sealing vent common mistake multicooker novices  Pressure cannot build device venting

failing inform homeowners ways avoid foreclosure  It fined credit agency Experian  3 million deceiving people value credit scores  The bureau announced earlier month  9 million worth checks mail database consumer complaints  contains 700 000 searchable listings   I can t good James Brown  I feel good  Hensarling said Republican colleagues Financial Services Committee cast votes favor title: China send special envoy North Korea Friday  signaling potential thaw
text: China send special envoy North Korea Friday  days President Trump s visit Asia  Chinese North Korean state media announced Wednesday  marking potential diplomatic thaw Pyongyang Beijing  The announcement closely follows Trump s Tuesday departure Asia 13 day trip North Korea topped agenda  Chinese President Xi Jinping send special envoy Song Tao  head China s ruling Communist Party s International Liaison Department  Pyongyang  according announcement  Trump made pressuring China centerpiece strategy thwart North Korea s ambition developing ability launch nuclear strike continental U S  In Beijing last week  pressured Xi work  very hard  issue  said  Xi  turn   stated upping sanctions  North Korea  Trump tweeted Saturday   The optimistic spin Donald Trump got Chinese  maybe Chinese taking seriously   they re going send somebody Pyongyang talk coming around nuclear program  said Robert Kelly  associate professor political science Pusan National University South Korea   But it s probably information sharing   North Koreans want know what s going on   The timing strongly suggests response Trump trip  continued   But past American presidents pushed China North Korea before  China s never come around  Song  envoy   inform  North Korea s leadership outcome 19th party congress  major political conclave Beijing last month appointed Xi second five year term  China s official New China News Agency reported  Song visited Vietnam Laos  fellow Communist states  mission following congress  At regular briefing Wednesday  Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang said Song intends brief North Korean leaders congress  He declined specify whether envoy would also discuss Pyongyang s nuclear ambitions   During visit  exchange views major issues common concern  Geng said  China North Korea s main ally trading partner  accounting 90  isolated state s trade volume  Yet China North Korea relations deteriorated recent months  Beijing rattled Pyongyang s recent string missile tests   country conducted 15 since February   nuclear test September  occurred hours Xi s introductory speech major international summit southeast China  No ministerial level Chinese official visited North Korea since 2015  Liu Yunshan  member all powerful Politburo Standing Committee  met Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un Pyongyang  Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Liu Zhenmin visited Pyongyang October 2016  Few details either visit made public  North Korea tested missile two months  China pledged enforce latest round United Nations Security Council sanctions  approved August  could cut  1 billion North Korea s export revenue take full effect January  Yet analysts say China s North Korea strategy hasn t fundamentally changed decades   Beijing worries instability Pyongyang could damage national interests  yet take measures would truly strangle northeastern neighbor  Trump  trip  times appeared hold olive branch Pyongyang  While Seoul  suggested Kim  come table make deal  Yet near end trip appeared reverse course insulting Kim Twitter  insinuating  short fat  North Korea s official Korean Central News Agency responded Trump s trip characteristic vitriol  calling U S  president  old lunatic  It criticized Japan U S   increasing danger nuclear war   Japan mind face miserable end go recklessly relying U S  paper tiger  said  CAPTION A gunman killed four people title: Senate tax bill ditches stock option change outcry tech start ups
text: A revised Senate tax bill ditched change treatment stock options outcry technology start ups  The original bill released last week proposed tax stock options date vest instead cashed in  Technology start ups Hyperloop One  Airbnb  Uber Vimeo complained change would make harder attract employees  More 600 start ups  venture capitalists technology executives signed letter Tuesday Senate Finance Committee Chairman Orrin Hatch  R Utah  urging remove provision  Late Tuesday night  Hatch released revised tax bill that  The new bill also made number changes  including designating new lower individual tax rates expire end 2025 repealing mandate Affordable Care Act Americans health insurance  In addition  revised Senate bill includes language Empowering Employees Through Stock Ownership Act  proposed last year Sens  Dean Heller  R Nev  Mark Warner  D Va  would give employees new flexibility paying taxes stock options company offers 80  workforce   Start ups rely stock options stock based incentives offer competitive compensation market large incumbent firms easily pay higher salaries  Engine  advocacy group technology start ups organized letter Hatch  said Wednesday   The changes Senate tax plan go long way promoting start ups job creation across country  group said  The change tax treatment stock options original Senate tax bill would produced  13 4 billion additional federal tax revenue next decade  according analysis congressional Joint Committee Taxation  But provision would problem employees start ups  often hold options  hopefully value rises growth company  Employees could faced large tax bills realized income cashing stock options pay them  A similar stock option tax change original version House Republican tax bill  But provision removed last week House Ways Means Committee approved amendment several changes offered panel s chairman  Rep  Kevin Brady  R Texas  However  bills continue target stock options source tax revenue  though way affects tech sector particular  They would eliminate loophole allows publicly traded companies deduct cost stock options performance based compensation top executives  The tax code limits deduction pay compensation  1 million executive  But loophole allows companies exceed limit performance based pay  The provision  place since 1990s  blamed helping cause sharp rise executive compensation publicly traded corporations multiple industries  Eliminating would produce  10 billion additional federal tax revenue 10 years  CAPTION A gunman killed four people injured least 10 title: China send special envoy North Korea Friday  signaling potential thaw
text: China send special envoy North Korea Friday  days President Trump s visit Asia  Chinese North Korean state media announced Wednesday  marking potential diplomatic thaw Pyongyang Beijing  The residential buildings collapsed 500 villages affected  tens thousands homeless  The magnitude 7 3 earthquake  struck near mountainous Iran Iraq border Sunday night  also killed 10 people Iraq wounded
