means   Here s what s happening Zimbabwe  How Zimbabwe get here  At heart Zimbabwe s political economic crisis survival long term ruling party ZANU PF  In work  I argued ZANU PF survived part because  country s political economic stability declined last decade  nearly quarter adult population emigrated   leaving one challenge ruling party  A weakening opposition facing strong  stable ZANU PF made change unlikely  However  recently ZANU PF fractured destabilized  Why  One person whose motives central crisis Grace Mugabe  52  Since last election 2013 Grace Mugabe s leadership  ZANU PF expelled eruptions  giant meteor strikes  like one wiped dinosaurs approximately 66 million years ago  The current mass extinction stands apart it s largely caused humans  researchers say  From pollution deforestation  overpopulation  poaching  warming oceans  extreme weather events tied global warming  human activity primary fuel behind new era irreversible species loss  Humans leaving world  a much  much poorer place  Elizabeth Kolbert  author  The Sixth Extinction  staff writer New Yorker  told CBS News  In Pulitzer Prize winning book  Kolbert argues depleting planet s biodiversity looks likely title: A simple rule calculating stand college savings
text: Multiply child s age  2 000 get rough estimate  Fidelity says  Saving college daunting  sticker price even state schools edges ever higher  To help families get rough idea whether track meet college savings goals  Fidelity Investments promoting rule thumb  Multiply child s age  2 000 get back of the napkin estimate much saved point  The number based goal saving half cost four years public  in state university  average cost 2016   including tuition  room board  fees    20 000 annually  according College Board  It assumes savings start child born start college age 18  The guideline assumes funds invested tax advantaged account  like state sponsored 529 savings plan  no surprise  Fidelity manages several plans  Coverdell education savings account  also tax benefits  much lower annual contribution limits  According rule  child 2   4 000 saved  10   20 000 set aside   It s reasonable number  look public school costs  said Keith Bernhardt  vice president retirement college products Fidelity  But aim saving half cost   Almost one pays 100 percent cost right savings  Bernhardt said  People generally pay college combination current income  grants scholarships  loans  addition savings  Financial advisers say rule s simplicity may help families begin often seems like overwhelming task  Most parents save even more  however  investment returns inherently uncertain   It s catchy  Robert Carroll  financial planner Carnegie Investment Counsel Cincinnati  said so called 2K rule   But it s starting point  Lauren Haynes  fee only financial planner Evolution Advisers Midlothian  Virginia  said 50 percent target included expectation students would get sort assistance  may optimistic   Most clients paying full freight  said  Bernhardt acknowledges rule s simplicity comes trade offs  For one thing  average cost four year private college currently double amount public school  So  child gunning Ivy League  multiply initial number rule thumb times two  totals become eye popping   For 14 year old  formula  2 000 times 14 times 2  total  56 000  Fidelity also offers customizable online calculator lets change variables  like type college percentage college costs title: Twitter s problem hate  verification
text: Kara Alaimo  assistant professor public relations Hofstra University  author   Pitch  Tweet  Engage Street  How Practice Global Public Relations Strategic Communication   She spokeswoman international affairs Treasury Department Obama administration  Follow Twitter  karaalaimo   The opinions expressed commentary solely author   CNN  This week  Twitter stopped verifying accounts public outcry company bestowed coveted blue check mark next Twitter handle white supremacist Jason Kessler  But  effort resolve public relations disaster  company trying solve wrong problem  According vague explanation website  Twitter verifies identities behind accounts high profile people like politicians  celebrities journalists they re  of public interest  This way  readers know they re real  That s important  users tried impersonate people like Antnio Guterres  UN Secretary General  But Twitter came fire verifying Kessler s account  verification creates appearance social media giant might condone viewpoints  It would outrageous Twitter suggest Kessler s positions acceptable  As seen Twitter bio  Kessler helped organize Unite Right protest Charlottesville  Virginia  August  The event drew counter rally car drove crowd  32 year old anti hate protester Heather Heyer killed  Nineteen people injured  And Kessler s Twitter handle shows picture Confederate flag  After account verified Wednesday  Kessler bragged Twitter earned platform s mark  distinction  Twitter couldn t possibly condone Kessler s ideas  right  There thin line  social platform s real problem comes play  Twitter doesn t authentication problem  It hate problem  The company s rules threatening violence harassing people regularly violated impunity   sometimes official nod social media platform itself  Kessler s little blue check generated much backlash Twitter acknowledged Thursday  Verification meant authenticate identity   voice interpreted endorsement indicator importance  That part true  But company also announced   We recognize created confusion need resolve it  We paused general verifications work report back soon  That s company went wrong  Instead reevaluating verification process  reevaluating response hateful abusive behavior platform   The Twitter Rules  acknowledge one factor company considers evaluates abusive behavior whether  the behavior newsworthy legitimate public interest  But taking account whether something newsworthy deciding whether constitutes abuse isn t public interest  In September  example  Twitter asked hadn t cracked one President Donald Trump s tweets said North Korean President foreign minister might  be around much longer  company said let tweet stand newsworthy  This means that  you re famous powerful  and thus newsworthy  it s easier get away bullying people online  In words  instills system exploitation powerful  But one allowed abuse people Twitter  regardless  newsworthy  are  Twitter apply standards people  What they re nothing short discrimination  Follow CNN Opinion Join us Twitter Facebook Of course  greater clarification process verification would welcome  For example  company repeatedly denied requests authenticate Twitter handle without explanation  even though I meet criteria website  But that s real problem  If Twitter followed rule supporting what s public s interest  wouldn t end verifying accounts white supremacists hateful people  accounts wouldn t exist first place  Twitter s real problem official rules actually allow people promulgate hate abuse   they re important enough

title: The state leading way health care
text: Frederick Isasi executive director Families USA  health care advocacy organization  Jonathan Schleifer executive director The Fairness Project  national organization supports state local ballot initiatives  The opinions expressed commentary own   CNN  Could state one farthest corners country finally help us turn corner health care  It looked like Tuesday people Maine voted decisively expand Medicaid wishes governor  Paul LePage  bringing health care coverage 70 000 people state  many first time  This extraordinary ballot box accomplishment state voters   grass roots organizers   could potentially spark movement across country expand lock Medicaid access  bringing health care millions Americans  It s already happening Alaska Utah  similar campaigns getting ground  Idaho may next  And local groups around country watching closely see success Maine could herald potential success states  Maine s governor vetoed expansion five times  voters took matters hands   Mainers shown understand means don t access health care  They moved action deep compassion fellow citizens  something that s noticeably missing proposals Capitol Hill could take away health care tens millions people Take Kathleen Phelps Wilton  Maine  Phelps hairdresser 30 years suffers chronic obstructive pulmonary disease   COPD  lung disease makes difficult breathe  Until Tuesday  Phelps didn t qualify Medicaid earns little much  young Medicare  She often faced agonizing  impossible decision whether pay bills pay oxygen  Now Phelps finally covered Medicaid  There millions Americans like her  make life death choices can t get coverage  Our elected leaders moral obligation fight people without care  avoid responsibility  citizens take action control destiny  There much debate Washington  the federal government  record number people signed health coverage ACA first days open enrollment  They rebuke many conservative politicians Congress  claim fulfilling voters  even championing proposals overturn dismantle nation s safety net  It felt like entire nation sitting edge seat July Sen  John McCain followed colleagues  Sens  Susan Collins Lisa Murkowski  delivered last word thumbs vote  But President Donald Trump bluntly called undermining ACA eliminating individual mandate part tax reform package  would raise cost health care need most  Join us Twitter Facebook Fortunately  face relentless attack health care  Maine demonstrated ballot initiatives powerful way Americans go offense support quality life  At time everyone expects health care go one direction   fewer people title: Spinach didn t cause man s  Popeye  arm
text: CNN  Before Batman  Superman Captain America  another superhero massive muscles every little boy aspired be  But  one elderly man recently found out  bulging biceps don t always mean super strength  The distinct  exaggerated muscle protrusion closely associated comic strip character relatively uncommon medical condition named him   Popeye  sign occurs one tendons connects biceps shoulder tears  partially completely  resulting visible bulge muscle underneath skin  A classic presentation published today The New England Journal Medicine  Dr  Naoki Yoshida  submitted photograph  said first saw patient  immediately became excited   It exactly I saw textbook  said Yoshida  young orthopedic surgeon Shonan Kamakura General Hospital Japan   I knew without taking MRI X ray  But  said   The affected part actually soft pillowy  hard muscle like Popeye  Yoshida said 79 year old man  tried lift rather light cardboard box home felt sharp pain  shoulder  He looked right away saw bulge upper left arm  Follow CNN Health Facebook Twitter See latest news share comments CNN Health Facebook Twitter   A physical examination revealed obvious deformity anterior mid upper arm became pronounced elbow flexion  joint bends  Yoshida wrote Journal   Magnetic resonance imaging  MRI  shoulder revealed complete rupture long head biceps tendon  Dr  Elizabeth Maskin   orthopedic surgeon Brigham Women s Hospital Boston  estimates sees  Popeye  sign least week busy sports medicine practice   Most people come went lift something heavy hear feel pop upper arm  feel pain biceps  said   But usually worries next day  lot bruising area  Maskin  also spokeswoman American Academy Orthopaedic Surgeons   explained two heads proximal biceps tendon  long head ruptures far frequently short head   The proximal tendon like rope  said   Over time use  fray wear rope  It s surprise  then   Popeye  sign usually seen people 55 older  though serious tennis players golfers may experience biceps tendon tear younger age  When athletes pain  Maskin said  sometimes rupture  may actually ease pain  may feel even better  Because biceps muscle connected shoulder two tendons  losing one connection typically result significant loss strength   Occasionally  patients need physical therapy  said   but time come back four six weeks  they re feeling better  Physical therapy doctor ordered case another man  Popeye  sign  Internal medicine physician Dr  Jorge Scheirer co authored 2013 entry Journal Community Hospital Internal Medicine Perspectives highlighted case 72 year old man  a history bilateral rotator cuff tears    risk factor tendon tears  Scheirer  vice president chief medical information officer Tower Health Pennsylvania  said he s seen four five cases  Popeye  sign 20 year career  The best treatment patients  said  RICE   Rest  Ice  Compression  Elevation  Both Scheirer Maskin said proximal tendon tears almost always treated without surgery  An operation would primarily address cosmetic concerns leave behind visible scar  Tears distal tendon  connects biceps muscle elbow  rare usually result greater disability need reattached surgical procedure  Scheirer said patients require painkillers  avoids prescribing nonsteroidal anti inflammatory drugs   aspirin ibuprofen   older patients whenever possible  Studies linked NSAIDs increased risk heart attack  especially older adults  Considering patient s age medical needs  Yoshida advised surgery recommended pain relievers  The medication worked  man s pain dissipated matter months  His arm still looks title: The state leading way health care
text: Frederick Isasi executive director Families USA  health care advocacy organization  Jonathan Schleifer executive director The Fairness Project  national organization supports state local ballot initiatives  The opinions expressed commentary own   CNN  Could state one farthest corners country finally help us turn corner health care  It looked like Tuesday people Maine voted decisively expand Medicaid wishes governor  Paul LePage  bringing health care coverage 70 000 people state  many first time  This extraordinary ballot box accomplishment state voters   grass roots organizers   could potentially spark movement across country expand lock Medicaid access  bringing health care millions Americans  It s already happening Alaska Utah  similar campaigns getting ground  Idaho may next  And local groups around country watching closely see success Maine could herald potential success states  Maine s governor vetoed expansion five times  voters took matters hands   Mainers shown understand means don t access health care  They moved action deep compassion fellow citizens  something that s noticeably missing proposals Capitol Hill could take away health care tens millions people Take Kathleen Phelps Wilton  Maine  Phelps hairdresser 30 years suffers chronic obstructive pulmonary disease   COPD  lung disease makes difficult breathe  Until Tuesday  Phelps didn t qualify Medicaid earns little much  young Medicare  She often faced agonizing  impossible decision whether pay bills pay oxygen  Now Phelps finally covered Medicaid  There millions Americans like her  make life death choices can t get coverage  Our elected leaders moral obligation fight people without care  avoid responsibility  citizens take action control destiny  There much debate Washington  the people  want  But people quite clear  Americans every political persuasion want affordable comprehensive health care themselves  families vulnerable communities  In fact  week  marketing publicity federal government  record number people signed health coverage ACA first days open enrollment  They rebuke many conservative politicians Congress  claim fulfilling voters  even championing proposals would leave families worse off  grappling exorbitant health care costs struggling pre existing conditions  The proposals Congress put forward would also greatly diminish national commitment vulnerable society stripping federal support Medicaid  It  repeal replace  attempts year sparked national awakening  showing collective voices real power  Supporters Affordable Care Act blocked effort Congress overturn dismantle nation s safety net  It felt like entire nation sitting edge seat July Sen  John McCain followed colleagues  Sens  Susan Collins Lisa Murkowski  delivered last word thumbs vote  But threat didn t end there  even weeks later another vote failed  Just last week  members Congress proposed paying part tax plan eliminating deduction Americans high medical costs  And recently  President Donald Trump bluntly called undermining ACA eliminating individual mandate part tax reform package  would raise cost health care need most  Join us Twitter Facebook Fortunately  face relentless attack health care  Maine demonstrated ballot initiatives powerful way Americans go offense support quality life  At time everyone expects health care go one direction   fewer people getting expensive coverage   voters stood one voice said  no  political gamesmanship insisted taking care vulnerable  It won t last time

title: An Alabama Robocall Invokes Ugly Tropes
text: Alabama s Senate race received ugly new wrinkle Tuesday night  thanks apparent series robocalls seemed designed fan resentments of press  Northerners  perhaps Jewish reporters  Local news station WKRG reported one viewers received robocall man impersonating Washington Post reporter  In it  man offers pay women thousands dollars they ll make false accusations Roy Moore  state s former chief justice Republican candidate replace Jeff Sessions Senate  Hi  Lenny Bernstein  I m reporter The Washington Post calling find anyone address female ages 54 57 years old willing make damaging remarks candidate Roy Moore reward  5 000  7 000 dollars  We fully investigating claims  however  make written report  I reached email lbernstein washingtonpost com  Thank you  Taken face value  call appears hamfisted effort discredit Post s bombshell reporting Moore s interactions young women county prosecutor 1970s  The newspaper interviewed four women said Moore made efforts court early 30s teenagers  One them  Leigh Corfman  said Moore made sexual contact 14 years old  Those stories sparked political firestorm Moore headache national Republicans  many already uneasy firebrand jurist  After fifth woman came forward Monday accuse sexual assault  high ranking GOP legislators Washington  including Speaker Paul Ryan Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell  called Moore step aside  Moore  part  denied denounced allegations made him  He s also refused step aside contest Alabama s Senate seat even polls show lead narrowing  Moore supporters repeatedly blamed media troubles  And Tuesday night  attorney released letter sent Alabama Media Group threatening legal action response reporting  The Washington Post swiftly denounced robocalls Tuesday night   The Post learned least one person Alabama received call someone falsely claiming The Washington Post  Marty Baron  newspaper s executive editor  told WKRG   The call s description reporting methods bears relationship reality  We shocked appalled anyone would stoop level discredit real journalism  To make matters confusing  there s actually journalist working Post named Lenny Bernstein  He covers health related topics  politics  On Twitter  defended name criticized sought use slander employer  To who ve touch  Thanks support  For record  I definitely DO work Post definitely DON T report way  Appalling effort discredit great work Post journos do    Lenny Bernstein  LennyMBernstein  November 15  2017 Impersonating journalist smear entire profession nasty enough maneuver own  But Alabama robocall also seems draw upon dark motifs anti Semitism accomplish goal  The fake Bernstein s nasally  high pitched voice forced New York accent evoke anti Semitic caricatures stereotypes   The real Bernstein  record  sounds nothing like this
